intro: Sugerokia umbellata, commonly known as the sweetroot or Indian breadroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has a thick, tuberous root that is historically used by indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a mild, sweet aroma. Sugerokia umbellata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands.
